pr_title: Remove time-zone dependent call when casting a date via toLocalDate in HiveIcebergFilterFactory

timeline.message: Fix off by one error in TestHiveIcebergFilterFactory#testDateType so the gmtDate is 2015-11-12 instead of 2015-11-11
Use Date.valueOf instead of the confusing 2015-11-13 with start of day changes etc
Use the dateString as a named parameter, so that hopefully these tests could be parameterized one day

timeline.bodyText: We need to avoid using classes that will change behavior based on time zone to parse the value of a date or timestamp. This method was purposely not used. The problem here is probably that although the instant value is correct, the Date uses the JVM time zone somehow.
timeline.author: rdblue

replies.bodyText: I had a feeling this method was purposely not used, but I wasn't sure of a better option so I figured I'd open the PR and then let somebody point it out. I also figured that the flakey test was indicative of more than just a flakey test. I'll apply your suggestions this evening after work.
replies.author: kbendick

replies.bodyText: I reverted this to the previous code. It's running on my local now with the patch for daysFromDate.
